datafield.subfield: Shelfmark: Ann Arbor, University of Michigan, Special Collections Library, Isl. Ms. 456

Origin: As appears in colophon on fol.206b, copied ("wa-faragha min kitbatih [kitābatih ?]...") by Walī ibn Muṣṭafā ibn Isḥaq (Veli b. Mustafa b. İshak). Below the colophon, the date 906 [1500 or 1501] has been supplied ("تاريخه سنة ستة وتسعمائة"), perhaps by one of the glossators (compare gloss in upper margin and scribal verses in outer margin). A birth notice below the colophon ("تاريخ مولود عبدى بن ولى خليفة [؟] سنة تسع وتسعمائة") is further dated 909 [1503 or 4], likely supplied by one of the glossators. Paper, hand, etc. are consistent with a late 15th century dating.
Accompanying materials: Inventory cataloguing slip in hand of Winifred Smeaton Thomas along with several slips tipped in or bound in (see fol.40-41, fol.85-86, fol.102-103, etc.).
Former shelfmark: From inner front cover, "IL 344a" (likely supplied by Yahuda, see acquisitions slip).

Binding: Thin pasteboard covered in brown leather with red leather repairs ; once Type II binding (with flap) though only traces of fore-edge flap remain ; upper and lower covers carry large gold-stamped central mandorla (compare Déroche class. OAi6) with pendants and gold-stamped border ; board linings of marbled paper in blue, red, and white ; endpapers of marbled paper in red, blue, green, yellow, and purple ; in poor condition, though much repaired.

Support: non-European (likely Arab) laid paper with chain lines running vertically and grouped in threes ; laid lines running horizontally and spaced roughly 9 laid lines per cm. ; endpapers of heavy European laid paper, chain lines clearly visible and spaced roughly 22-27 mm. apart, bearing watermark with crown, grapes (raisin) and name "VANANT" [?].
Decoration: Sūrah headings and Qurʼānic excerpts rubricated.

Script: Naskh ; clear, neat Turkish hand in a medium line ; entirely sans serif, rounded with curvilinear descenders, effect of slight tilt to the left, some elongation of horizontal strokes, pointing in distinct dots or strokes (representing three dots in particular), point of final nūn often assimilated with bowl ; glosses in various hands.
Layout: Written in 25 ines per page ; frame-ruled (impression of ruling board evident).

Collation: 20 V (200), III+1 (207) ; quinions followed by ternion with added leaf ; seventh quire has misplaced single bifolium, correctly paginated and now inserted between fol.63b and fol.64a (Western pagination) ; catchwords present but occasionally cut off due to trimming of leaves ; pagination in pencil, Western numerals (supplied during cataloguing, referenced in description).

Colophon: "Scribal," triangular or trapezoidal, reads: "والحمد لله رب العالمين والصلوة والسلام على خير خلقه محمد واله واصحابه وعترته الطيبين الطاهرين اجمعين وفرغ من كتبته [؟] العبد الضعيف المفتقر الى رحمة الله تعالى وغفرانه ولي بن مصطفى بن اسحق غفر الله لهم ولجميع اقربائهم امين يا رب العالمين تم"
Explicit: "اخبرنا...انه قال النبي صلى الله ع م يقول ما اذن الله لشيء ما اذن لنبي حسن الصوت بالقران يجهر به اخر الكتاب"
Incipit: "سورة يس مكية بسم الله الرحمن الرحيم يس ول والقلم باخفاء النون..."

Fourth volume of al-Baghawī's commentary on the Qur'an, from Sūrat Yā Sīn (36) to Sūrat al-Nās (114). Lengthy extratextual quotations, notes, and glosses following the text and on slips tipped in or bound in various places (see fol.40-41, fol.85-86, fol.102-103, etc.).
Acquired in 1926 from the bookseller Isaac Benjamin S.E. Yahuda via purchase transacted on his behalf by Abraham Shalom Yahuda (1877-1951), his younger brother.

On recto of front flyleaf, ownership statement and circular seal impression (seemingly dated 1156 [1743 or 4]) in the name of Mehmet Emin Atıf ( Muḥammad Amīn ʻĀṭif / محمد امين عاطف ), statement reads "مما تشرف به العبد المذنب محمد امين عاطف غفر له" (compare statement and seal impression in Isl. Ms. 420, statements in Isl. Mss. 453 and 454) ; marginal corrections, notabilia (side-heads), and glosses throughout.
